meanings.definition: To have the courage to do something beyond one's usual limits.
meanings.sent1: She decided to overdare herself by climbing the small hill in the park.
meanings.sent2: He overdared to try the new sport despite his fear of heights.
meanings.sent3: The cat overdared to jump from the couch to the table, feeling like a brave explorer.
meanings.sent4: The student overdared to speak up in class, breaking free from her shyness.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter overdared to enter the burning building to save the trapped puppy.

meanings.definition: To challenge someone to do something risky or dangerous.
meanings.sent1: He liked to overdare his friends to jump off the diving board into the pool.
meanings.sent2: The siblings overdared each other to sneak into the abandoned house at night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel overdared the bird to a nut-gathering race in the park.
meanings.sent4: The magician overdared the audience to believe in the impossible with his tricks.
meanings.sent5: The daredevil overdared his rival to perform a dangerous stunt on the motorcycle.
